intro: Rubus hirtiflorus, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of white to pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces edible berries that are typically dark purple to black in color. Native to the western United States, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage is usually covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
